stimulusHtml:
Fracti bello fatisque repulsi
 ductores Danaum tot iam labentibus annis
 instar montis equum divina Palladis arte
 aedificant, sectaque intexunt abiete costas;
5votum pro reditu simulant; ea fama vagatur.
 Huc delecta virum sortiti corpora furtim
 includunt caeco lateri penitusque cavernas
 ingentes uterumque armato milite complent.

Aeneid 2. 13-20

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 1 (Fracti . . . repulsi) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.

2. (A) What is the case of Fracti (line 1) and (B) which word does it modify?

3. (A) What are the case and number of secta (line 4) and (B) which word does it modify?

4. In lines 6-8 (Huc . . . complent), which four Latin words indicate that the Greeks selected certain men (to hide in the horse)?

5. (A) Identify all the direct objects of complent (line 8) and (B) translate them in context.

6. In this passage, which four Latin words indicate the length of time that the Greeks have spent in Troy?

7. Briefly describe one of the omens which persuades Anchises to leave Troy with his son in Book 1.
